column4: I needed to install b43-fwcutter, but i don't have any network connection so I downloaded it and "make"ed it. Do I just run the b43-fwcutter file now, to install it?
make install
Do you know anything about b43-fwcutter?
not much...i looked into it when i was attempting to get my wireless working but my problem was something with setting keycodes so idt ill be much help
but the link you gave looks pretty straightforward...if you can't get to the repo's id look into fixing that first and then follow the forum post exactly like it is
Ok, thats what im trying to do.  Its hard. Do you know, after i run make install, everything seemed successful, so can i move on to the next step?
I can't connect with either wireless or wired networks, thats my main issue

i understand...what you need to do though is figure that out first and then try the tutorial because compiling the fwcutter program from source prolly won't work the way the tutorial is doing it id guess
Ok thanks
I need to get fwcutter working to get wireless working, and i need to get online to get fwcutter. What an awesome loop :P
what does apt-get install say when you run it?
to download fwcutter
cannot find package
try apt-cache search b43-fwcutter
nothing returns
try apt-get update...if your sources.list file is setup right it should pull all the packages from those repo's in
i get "b43-fwcutter - Utility for extracting Broadcom 43xx firmware" when i do apt-cache search b43-fwcutter on my comp
It always errors when I try that, it can't resolve any of the hostnames because it can't connect to a network
so how are you on here if you can't get on that network?
On my desktop.
can i PM you?
sure, i barley know irc so go for it. haha
